meta_description: One of the great head-scratchers of our time is that women are generally better than men in math and science when measured by school grade. Yet it tends to be the men who go and do all of the interesting and well-paid engineering and science jobs. Various explanations are put forward for this, including "Men just like this sorta stuff more" all the way to, "well, D’Oh, it's the patriarchy."
meta_title: Women are better than men at everything – that's why men should do the engineering
title: Women are better than men at everything – that's why men should do the engineering

body:
And by "everything" they actually mean "get better grades, but do worse on standardized testing, because they're bad at thinking but good at having teachers like them better for being girls," lmao.

But they did include this laugh riot, which made the entire thing worth it

>While grades are a more subjective measurement than test scores, we also include data from university students, whose grades are less affected by teachers’ assessment of behaviour.
body_html:
And by "everything" they actually mean "get better grades, but do worse on standardized testing, because they're bad at thinking but good at having teachers like them better for being girls," lmao.

But they did include this laugh riot, which made the entire thing worth it

While grades are a more subjective measurement than test scores, we also include data from university students, whose grades are less affected by teachers’ assessment of behaviour.

body: You're so insistent that women are inferior in every way that you deny basic evidence in favor of your own made up shit. Facts don't care about your feelings, nor fairness, nor your maledom fetish. Women are simply better than men in almost everything because men specialize so much in the physio-spatial realm, and are the expendable and replaceable sex, and that's just how it is. I'm male, do you think I *want* things to be this way? I even had a taste of happy feelings and abilities outside of sports before I hit puberty and the nostalgia kills me and cripples me every day, and I am doomed to spend the entire rest of my life like this.
body_html: You're so insistent that women are inferior in every way that you deny basic evidence in favor of your own made up shit. Facts don't care about your feelings, nor fairness, nor your maledom fetish. Women are simply better than men in almost everything because men specialize so much in the physio-spatial realm, and are the expendable and replaceable sex, and that's just how it is. I'm male, do you think I want things to be this way? I even had a taste of happy feelings and abilities outside of sports before I hit puberty and the nostalgia kills me and cripples me every day, and I am doomed to spend the entire rest of my life like this.

body:
The specific evidence you're ignoring is the evidence of standardized testing and the undeniable (yet you'll deny it) subjectivity of grading in combination with the known [women are wonderful effect](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Women-are-wonderful_effect)

Sorry bro, you are just wrong, but keep clinging to your delusions, I know they are very important 2 u.
body_html:
The specific evidence you're ignoring is the evidence of standardized testing and the undeniable (yet you'll deny it) subjectivity of grading in combination with the known women are wonderful effect

Sorry bro, you are just wrong, but keep clinging to your delusions, I know they are very important 2 u.

body: Since when did all of you suddenly begin trusting completely in standardized tests? Since you found it convenient that men are better at them I assume? What you're not considering is that they don't feel pressure to do well or study because they're girls, and girls aren't held to the same expectations. And very few people actually *like* academia after elementary or middle school, even nerds, so they're only going to put effort in if people force them to. In controlled experiments where everyone has the same environment the men do worse in every subject. And it lines up with sex differences seen in brain scans. Cope, both of us.
body_html: Since when did all of you suddenly begin trusting completely in standardized tests? Since you found it convenient that men are better at them I assume? What you're not considering is that they don't feel pressure to do well or study because they're girls, and girls aren't held to the same expectations. And very few people actually like academia after elementary or middle school, even nerds, so they're only going to put effort in if people force them to. In controlled experiments where everyone has the same environment the men do worse in every subject. And it lines up with sex differences seen in brain scans. Cope, both of us.

body: And they do worse because they won't face any consequences if they do poorly, whereas boys are expected to succeed because they have to be the providers in life. A girl being bad in school is generally looked upon as acceptable as long as they pass. A boy not getting straight A's is a big no-no. Girls actually still get better grades most of the time due to natural ability but might be more willing to blow things off because of never having to work as hard, and recognizing standardized tests as stupid and not beneficial to them this almost certainly happens.

A girl being bad in school is generally looked upon as acceptable as long as they pass. A boy not getting straight A's is a big no-no.
